title: Adele Wears Givenchy to the Grammys 2017 Red Carpet and Onstage - Vogue

organizations.name: red carpet and onstage - vogue adele

text: Adele’s Givenchy Grammys Red Carpet Look is Riccardo Tisci’s Swan Song February 13, 2017 12:04 AM by Edward Barsamian Photo: Getty Images Adele’s approach to red-carpet outfit planning, it turns out, is just like that of a fashion editor. “In general, we start months in advance, maybe five months for the Grammys ,” explains the star’s stylist, Gaelle Paul, of their process. “I look through all the fall haute couture shows online, make up picture boards with various looks from each designer, [and] we go through the boards together and pick out our favorite.” For tonight’s ensemble, Paul and Adele looked to Riccardo Tisci and Givenchy. "It’s mainly all about colors, that’s how we start,” says Paul of the arm- green silk satin and lace dress. “It always proves to be laborious to get the right colour to match a dress… but this is one of the reasons I love what Tisci does at Givenchy.” Punctuating the ensemble were delicate yet impactful jewels from Lorraine Schwartz. "The fun starts when you can get jewelers like XIV Karats or Lorraine Schwartz to make you up bespoke pieces,” Paul says. "They can dip white into yellow to make it gold, or dip it to rose, and they can reset stones and make them into new pieces.” (The elegant yellow gold brooch amping up Adele's militaristic dress was inspired by a fall 2016 Schwartz design.) As for the dress, as Paul describes, it’s the work of Tisci at his best. “It took 1,600 hours to make, as all panels are pleated separately and put together,” said the stylist of the intricate bodice. "I love the meshing of the unique, opulent, cerebral designs that are submerged in the past, yet so incredibly modern and feminine. The techniques he uses are exciting and give such depth to his creations. It’s opulent yet demure. I can trust Givenchy to deliver incredible gowns.” And with Adele slated to perform later tonight, here’s hoping she makes an equally grand style statement onstage.
